prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Susato Mikotoba
Description: A judicial assistant sent to Britain on a study tour. She's the epitome of a refined Japanese lady and a huge help to me always.
Character 1
Name: Iris Wilson
Description: An extraordinary young girl who lives with Mr Sholmes. She has a degree in medicine and is the author of a popular series of short stories.
Character 2
Name: Herlock Sholmes
Description: There's not a person in the world who hasn't heard of this famous great detective, whose deductions never fail to surprise.
Character 3
Name: Mael Stronghart
Description: The Lord Chief Justice, who wields absolute authority in judicial matters, including the appointment of lawyers. He's a thoroughly intimidating man.
Character 4
Name: Odie Asman
Description: The man who perished in the explosion on the experimentation stage at the Great Exhibition of London.↳The man who perished in the explosion on the experimentation stage. He was Professor Harebrayne's financial backer and the boss of a large criminal organisation.
Character 5
Name: Albert Harebrayne
Description: A scientist who invented a machine to demonstrate super-high-voltage instantaneous kinesis. However, it exploded in use, and he is now accused of murder.↳A scientist who invented a machine to demonstrate super-high-voltage instantaneous kinesis. He's the defendant of this case and a friend to Lord van Zieks, apparently.
Character 6
Name: Barok van Zieks
Description: A prosecutor known as the Reaper of the Bailey. Supposedly, the souls of those he prosecutes are eternally damned, one way or another.
Character 7
Name: Masked Man
Description: An apprentice of Lord van Zieks whose face is always covered by a mask. He has the air of a completely unassailable man.
Character 8
Name: Gina Lestrade
Description: A mostly reformed pickpocket who's now a self-appointed 'detective inspector'. She's really making waves in her new apprenticeship.
Character 9
Name: Tobias Gregson
Description: The detective inspector in charge of Scotland Yard's investigation of the case. He's stern and single-minded in his approach, and a great lover of fish and chips.
Character 10
Name: Esmeralda Tusspells
Description: The proprietress of the Madame Tusspells Museum of Waxwork and the latest in a line of artisans privy to the secret Tusspells technique of capturing a perfect likeness.
Character 11
Name: Balthazar Lune
Description: The impresario of short pleasure voyages in flying balloons. The balloons above the experimentation state all belonged to this man.
Character 12
Name: Bohemian Boy
Description: A young boy who came to London to visit the Great Exhibition. His real name is Wilhelm Gottsreich Sigismond Ormstein.↳A young prince from the royal family of Bohemia with an excessively long name. He witnessed the explosion at the Great Exhibition.
Character 13
Name: Courtney Sithe
Description: Scotland Yard coroner, leader of the Forensic Investigation Team and one of Lord Stronghart's most trusted allies.
Character 14
Name: Enoch Drebber
Description: A trickster who seems to be both an engineer and a magician. He constructed the machine for Professor Harebrayne's demonstration.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.
Evidence 1
Name: Great Exhibition Newspaper
Description: A newspaper containing various articles about the world-leading science and technology on show at the Great Exhibition being held in London.
Evidence 2
Name: Experiment Sketch
Description: A diagram showing the relative positions of the Crystal Tower and Professor Harebrayne's machine that exploded.
Evidence 3
Name: Mysterious Contraption → Crossbow
Description: A very curious device found behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds, almost as if it had been hidden there deliberately. A weapon found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It turns out that it's a folding crossbow. A crossbow found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It belongs to Mr Enoch Drebber.
Evidence 4
Name: Piece of Green Cloth
Description: A torn piece of canvas-like material backed with rubber that was found under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. There are scorch marks at the edges.
Evidence 5
Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim taken after he had ostensibly been 'beamed' to the Crystal Tower. It shows an apparent stab wound to the chest.
Evidence 6
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the victim, Mr Asman. His neck was broken from the impact of a violent fall and he was stabbed in the chest with a sharp object.
Evidence 7
Name: Screwdriver
Description: Professor Harebrayne's trusty screwdriver that he's named 'Andrew'. There are traces of blood at the tip and it matches the shape of the victim's wound. A metal screwdriver that was found poking through the grille in the base of what remains of the kinesis machine. It has a very distinctive handle.
Evidence 8
Name: Photograph of the Balloon
Description: A photograph taken by Gotts whilst he was riding in a balloon. It shows another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after he took this shot.
Evidence 9
Name: Drebber's Card
Description: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, though it shows only the man's name. There is no address. Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, which lists no address for the man. There is a smear of machine oil on the reverse.
Evidence 10
Name: Wooden 'Birdcage'
Description: The wooden cage that was used for Professor Harebrayne's experiment. This cage, with the victim inside, crashed down into the Crystal Tower. The wooden cage that was used for the demonstration. It crashed down, with the victim inside, into the Crystal Tower causing damage to its base.
Evidence 11
Name: Photograph of Drebber
Description: A photographic print of the engineer, Mr Enoch Drebber. It's hard to make out, but he appears to be wearing a monocle with black glass.
Evidence 12
Name: Camera
Description: The camera from around the neck of a waxwork in the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. When the lens is extended, dark staining can be seen on the bellows.
Evidence 13
Name: Piece of Broken Glass
Description: A small fragment of very unusual and thick glass that was found in the folds of the clothing of the Professor waxwork. It would appear to be from the Crystal Tower.
Evidence 14
Name: Science Trophy
Description: A Royal Society trophy for excellence in science that was found in Mr Drebber's workshop. It's a very prestigious award for a young scientist.
Evidence 15
Name: Waxwork Head
Description: The head of the Professor waxwork that was stolen from the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.
Evidence 16
Name: Killer's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the mass murderer known as the Professor, who was tried and found guilty by closed trial ten years ago.
Evidence 17
Name: Post-Explosion Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the experimentation stage after it was completely levelled by a time bomb. The metal floor of the stage has been blown open by the explosion.
Evidence 18
Name: Drebber's Contract
Description: The contract between Mr Asman and Mr Drebber detailing the terms by which they would profit from the kinesis experiment.
Evidence 19
Name: Ten-Year-Old Article
Description: A newspaper article recounting the tale of an eyewitness to the alleged 'resurrection' of the Professor from his grave on the night of his execution.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The corpse that went crashin' through the Crystal Tower had a broken neck.
Person: Gregson
Testimony 1
Testimony: I, I made a minor miscalculation in the angle of the beam projection, that's all! That was my mistake!
Person: Harebrayne
Testimony 2
Testimony: But the post-mortem examination revealed another injury. A fatal wound.
Person: Gregson
Testimony 3
Testimony: There was a lesion in his chest where he'd clearly been stabbed by somethin' sharp right in the heart!
Person: Gregson
Testimony 4
Testimony: So the victim was killed before he went anywhere. And this fella's the only one who could have done it!
Person: Gregson
Testimony 5
Testimony: The weapon the victim was stabbed with must have been left in his body whilst he was beamed through the air!
Person: Gregson

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants one pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

First, I need to go through each testimony and see what they claim, then check the evidence list for any that would oppose that.

Looking at the testimonies:

Testimony 0 by Gregson: The corpse had a broken neck. The autopsy report (Evidence 6) confirms this, so no contradiction here.

Testimony 1: Harebrayne admits a miscalculation in the beam angle. The Experiment Sketch (Evidence 2) shows the positions, but I'm not sure if that directly contradicts. Maybe not.

Testimony 2: Gregson says the post-mortem found another injury, a fatal wound. The autopsy report (Evidence 6) mentions a stab wound and broken neck. So that's consistent. No contradiction.

Testimony 3: Gregson states the victim was stabbed in the heart with something sharp. The Screwdriver (Evidence 7) has traces of blood and matches the wound. So the screwdriver is the murder weapon. But the testimony is about the cause, which the evidence supports. So maybe not a contradiction here.

Testimony 4: Gregson claims Harebrayne is the only one who could have done it. But maybe evidence shows someone else had access. Let's check. The Crossbow (Evidence 3) belongs to Drebber. If the screwdriver is Harebrayne's but the crossbow is Drebber's, maybe there's another possible weapon. Wait, but the Screwdriver is the one matching the wound. So perhaps the crossbow isn't the murder weapon, but maybe the testimony says the stab was done by Harebrayne. But if the crossbow is Drebber's, maybe he could be involved. Not sure if that's a direct contradiction.

Testimony 5: Gregson says the weapon was left in the body during beaming. But the Screwdriver (Evidence 7) was found in the machine's remains. If the weapon was left in the body, how did it end up in the machine? Wait, the autopsy report (Evidence 6) says the stab wound was from a sharp object. The screwdriver has blood traces and matches the wound. If the screwdriver was left in the body, then how was it found in the machine? So if the testimony says the weapon was left in the body during beaming, but the screwdriver was found in the machine, that's a contradiction. Because if it was left in the body, it should have been with the victim when he was beamed to the Crystal Tower, but the screwdriver is found in the machine's remains. So the evidence (Screwdriver, 7) contradicts testimony 5. That would be the pair. Let me check again.

Testimony 5: "The weapon... must have been left in his body whilst he was beamed through the air!" So the weapon should have been in the body when it was transported. But the Screwdriver (Evidence 7) is found in the machine's remains, not in the body. Therefore, the presence of the screwdriver in the machine contradicts the testimony that it was left in the body. Therefore, Evidence 7 contradicts Testimony 5.

Person: Harebrayne

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. So, the user is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. They want just one pair. Let me go through the testimonies and evidences step by step.

First, let's list out the testimonies. All of them are from Harebrayne (Character 5). Testimony 0 says he's still gathering data. Testimony 1 mentions his hypothesis that the kinesis can't transport metal, so a metal weapon would stay. Testimony 2 supports that there's no inconsistency. Testimony 3 states that Asman was his patron, essential for his work. Testimony 4 talks about protecting the machine they built together.

Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 7 is a screwdriver named Andrew with blood traces matching the victim's wound. It was found in the machine. Evidence 18 is Drebber's contract with Asman, detailing profit terms. Evidence 3 is the crossbow belonging to Drebber found under the stage. Evidence 6 is the autopsy report stating the victim had a broken neck and a stab wound. Evidence 5 is a photo showing a stab wound. Evidence 7's screwdriver would be the murder weapon, which is metal.

Harebrayne's Testimony 1 says that metal objects aren't transported by the kinesis machine. But the screwdriver (Evidence 7) was found in the machine. Wait, if the machine can't transport metal, how did the screwdriver end up there? Unless the screwdriver was already part of the machine. But the screwdriver is the murder weapon. Wait, the victim was stabbed, and the screwdriver has blood. If the machine can't transport metal, then the screwdriver should have stayed in the original location. But the victim was supposedly transported to the Crystal Tower via the machine. But if the machine doesn't move metal, then the screwdriver (metal) would remain in the machine's original location. However, the victim was found in the Crystal Tower with a stab wound from the screwdriver. That's a contradiction. Because if the machine transported the victim but not the screwdriver, the screwdriver shouldn't be with the victim. But according to Evidence 5 and 6, the victim was stabbed, and the screwdriver (Evidence 7) is the weapon. So, how did the screwdriver end up in the victim if the machine can't move metal? Unless the stabbing happened before the machine was activated, but the screwdriver was left behind. Wait, the screwdriver was found in the machine's remains. So maybe the machine exploded, and the screwdriver was there. But the victim was transported and then stabbed? That's confusing. 

Wait, the victim was in the wooden cage (Evidence 10) which crashed into the Crystal Tower. The screwdriver was found in the machine's base. So, maybe the screwdriver wasn't transported. But the victim's stab wound would have to be from the screwdriver before transportation. But according to Testimony 1, metal objects (like the screwdriver) wouldn't be transported. So if the screwdriver was used to stab the victim in the original location, it would stay there. But the victim was transported to the tower. However, the autopsy report (Evidence 6) says the victim's neck was broken from a fall and he was stabbed. So the stab wound could have occurred before the transportation. But the screwdriver (metal) wouldn't be transported, so it should still be in the original location. However, Evidence 7 says the screwdriver was found in the machine's remains. So that seems to fit because the machine didn't transport it. But the contradiction would be if the screwdriver was found in the transported location. Wait, no. The screwdriver was found in the machine's base, which is the original location. So maybe there's no contradiction here. Let me think again.

Alternatively, Testimony 3 says Asman was Harebrayne's patron. But Evidence 18 is a contract between Asman and Drebber, which might show that Drebber was involved financially. So if Harebrayne claims Asman was his sole patron, but the contract shows Drebber was also a backer, that could be a contradiction. Wait, Testimony 3: "Mr Asman was the patron of my research. Without him, my work wouldn't have been possible." But Evidence 18 is a contract between Asman and Drebber for profiting from the experiment. So perhaps Harebrayne didn't know about Drebber's involvement, or the contract shows that Drebber had a financial stake, contradicting Harebrayne's testimony that Asman was the sole patron. That could be a contradiction. But Harebrayne's testimony doesn't explicitly say that Asman was the only patron, just that he was the patron. So if Drebber was also involved via Asman, maybe that's not a direct contradiction. 

Another angle: Testimony 1 says the kinesis can't transport metal. Evidence 3 is the crossbow (metal) hidden under the stage. If the crossbow was used in the crime, but the machine couldn't transport it, that might not directly contradict unless the crossbow was part of the experiment. But the crossbow belongs to Drebber, so maybe he used it to cause the explosion. Not sure. 

Alternatively, the Experiment Sketch (Evidence 2) shows the positions of the Crystal Tower and the machine. If the machine's position relative to the tower is such that the transportation should have worked, but the screwdriver (metal) wasn't transported, that aligns with Testimony 1. So maybe no contradiction there. 

Wait, maybe Evidence 5 (Photograph of the Victim) shows the victim in the Crystal Tower with a stab wound. But according to Testimony 1, the metal screwdriver couldn't be transported. So if the screwdriver was used to stab him in the original location, the body would have been transported without the screwdriver. But the photo shows the victim with the stab wound at the Crystal Tower. So the wound must have been inflicted before transportation. But the screwdriver (metal) would remain in the original location. However, Evidence 7 says the screwdriver was found in the machine's remains. That's consistent because the machine didn't transport it. So where's the contradiction?

Wait, the Autopsy Report (Evidence 6) says the victim's neck was broken from a fall and he was stabbed. The fall could be from the cage crashing into the tower. The stab wound is from the screwdriver. So the victim was stabbed before being transported. The screwdriver, being metal, stayed in the original location (the machine's base), which is where it was found (Evidence 7). So that aligns with Testimony 1. So maybe no contradiction there.

Hmm. Let's think again. Maybe Testimony 3 where Harebrayne says Asman was his patron, but Evidence 18 (Drebber's Contract) shows that Asman and Drebber had a contract to profit from the experiment. If Harebrayne claims Asman was his sole backer, but Drebber was also involved, that's a contradiction. However, Harebrayne's Testimony 3 doesn't say Asman was the only backer, just that he was the patron. So if Drebber was working with Asman, maybe Harebrayne didn't know, but that's not a direct contradiction. 

Wait, another angle: Testimony 4 says Harebrayne has a duty to protect the machine they built together. But Evidence 3 is a crossbow hidden under the stage, belonging to Drebber. If Drebber was involved in sabotaging the machine, that might contradict Harebrayne's statement about protecting the machine, but that's more about intent than direct contradiction between evidence and testimony.

Alternatively, Evidence 7 (Screwdriver) being the murder weapon with blood matching the victim's wound, and Testimony 1 saying the machine can't transport metal. If the screwdriver was used to stab the victim in the original location, then transported with the body, but the machine shouldn't transport metal. Therefore, the screwdriver should have stayed behind, but the victim's body in the Crystal Tower has a stab wound from the screwdriver. But the screwdriver was found in the machine's base, not transported. So the stab wound must have occurred before transportation, and the screwdriver remained. But the victim's body was transported, so the wound would still be there. That's possible. So no contradiction here.

Wait, but the Autopsy Report (Evidence 6) says the victim was stabbed with a sharp object. The screwdriver (metal) was the weapon. If the machine can't transport metal, the screwdriver stayed in the original location. Therefore, the stab happened before the machine was activated. Then the body was transported, leaving the screwdriver behind. That's consistent. So maybe no contradiction.

Another possibility: The Mysterious Contraption (Evidence 3) is a crossbow belonging to Drebber. If the crossbow was used to cause the explosion or the murder, but according to Testimony 1, metal objects (like the crossbow's bolts) wouldn't be transported. But if the crossbow was used to trigger something, maybe the explosion, then the crossbow's presence under the stage (metal) is consistent. Not sure how this contradicts testimony.

Wait, Testimony 1 says that the machine cannot transport metal, so any metal weapon (like the crossbow's bolt) would stay. But if the crossbow was used to fire a bolt that caused the explosion or the victim's injury, but the bolt is metal, then the machine's inability to transport metal isn't directly conflicting unless the bolt was part of the experiment. Maybe not.

Let me look back. The key is to find a testimony and evidence that directly contradict each other. 

Looking at Testimony 3: "Mr Asman was the patron of my research. Without him, my work wouldn't have been possible." But Evidence 18 is Drebber's Contract with Asman. The contract details terms where Drebber and Asman would profit from the experiment. This suggests that Drebber was also financially involved. If Harebrayne claims that Asman was the sole patron, but Drebber had a contract with Asman for profits, that could imply that Drebber was a backer through Asman. However, Harebrayne's testimony doesn't explicitly say that Asman was the only one. It just says Asman was his patron. So unless the contract shows that Drebber was a direct backer, which might contradict Harebrayne's knowledge. But if the contract is between Asman and Drebber, then Asman might have been the middleman, so Harebrayne's statement is still true. So maybe that's not a contradiction.

Another angle: Evidence 7 (Screwdriver) is the murder weapon. If the screwdriver was used to stab Asman, and the machine can't transport metal (Testimony 1), then the screwdriver should have remained in the original location. The victim's body was transported to the tower, but the stab wound would still be present. The screwdriver was found in the machine's base (original location), which aligns with Testimony 1. So no contradiction here.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction is elsewhere. Let's check Testimony 2: "the point just raised by Mr Naruhodo isn't an inconsistency at all." But I'm not sure which point that refers to without context. Maybe not helpful.

Let me think again. Maybe the key is in the Autopsy Report (Evidence 6) stating the victim was stabbed and had a broken neck from a fall. The Experiment Sketch (Evidence 2) shows the positions. If the machine was supposed to transport the victim to the Crystal Tower, but the victim fell, causing the broken neck, that's possible. The stab wound is from the screwdriver, which was in the original location. So no contradiction.

Alternatively, Evidence 5 (Photograph of the Victim) shows the victim in the tower with a stab wound. If the machine transported him there, but the screwdriver (metal) couldn't be transported, then the stab must have occurred before transportation. The screwdriver was left behind, which is where it was found (Evidence 7). So that's consistent. No contradiction.

Wait, but if the victim was in the cage (Evidence 10) which was transported, and the screwdriver was used to stab him in the cage before activation, then the screwdriver would be inside the cage. But since the cage is wooden, maybe the machine can transport non-metal. So the cage and victim (non-metal) are transported, but the screwdriver (metal) would stay. But if the screwdriver was inside the cage, which is transported, does that contradict Testimony 1? Because the cage is transported, but the screwdriver inside is metal. Testimony 1 says the machine can't transport metal. So if the cage with the screwdriver inside was transported, that would contradict the testimony. Because the metal screwdriver would have been transported along with the cage. But according to the testimony, metal objects stay put. Therefore, if the screwdriver was inside the cage and transported, that's a contradiction. But according to Evidence 7, the screwdriver was found in the machine's base, which is the original location. So it wasn't transported. Therefore, no contradiction. So the screwdriver was not in the cage during transportation. The stab occurred before the machine was activated, the screwdriver was left in the original location, and the body was transported. prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Susato Mikotoba
Description: A judicial assistant sent to Britain on a study tour. She's the epitome of a refined Japanese lady and a huge help to me always.
Character 1
Name: Iris Wilson
Description: An extraordinary young girl who lives with Mr Sholmes. She has a degree in medicine and is the author of a popular series of short stories.
Character 2
Name: Herlock Sholmes
Description: There's not a person in the world who hasn't heard of this famous great detective, whose deductions never fail to surprise.
Character 3
Name: Mael Stronghart
Description: The Lord Chief Justice, who wields absolute authority in judicial matters, including the appointment of lawyers. He's a thoroughly intimidating man.
Character 4
Name: Odie Asman
Description: The man who perished in the explosion on the experimentation stage at the Great Exhibition of London.↳The man who perished in the explosion on the experimentation stage. He was Professor Harebrayne's financial backer and the boss of a large criminal organisation.
Character 5
Name: Albert Harebrayne
Description: A scientist who invented a machine to demonstrate super-high-voltage instantaneous kinesis. However, it exploded in use, and he is now accused of murder.↳A scientist who invented a machine to demonstrate super-high-voltage instantaneous kinesis. He's the defendant of this case and a friend to Lord van Zieks, apparently.
Character 6
Name: Barok van Zieks
Description: A prosecutor known as the Reaper of the Bailey. Supposedly, the souls of those he prosecutes are eternally damned, one way or another.
Character 7
Name: Masked Man
Description: An apprentice of Lord van Zieks whose face is always covered by a mask. He has the air of a completely unassailable man.
Character 8
Name: Gina Lestrade
Description: A mostly reformed pickpocket who's now a self-appointed 'detective inspector'. She's really making waves in her new apprenticeship.
Character 9
Name: Tobias Gregson
Description: The detective inspector in charge of Scotland Yard's investigation of the case. He's stern and single-minded in his approach, and a great lover of fish and chips.
Character 10
Name: Esmeralda Tusspells
Description: The proprietress of the Madame Tusspells Museum of Waxwork and the latest in a line of artisans privy to the secret Tusspells technique of capturing a perfect likeness.
Character 11
Name: Balthazar Lune
Description: The impresario of short pleasure voyages in flying balloons. The balloons above the experimentation state all belonged to this man.
Character 12
Name: Bohemian Boy
Description: A young boy who came to London to visit the Great Exhibition. His real name is Wilhelm Gottsreich Sigismond Ormstein.↳A young prince from the royal family of Bohemia with an excessively long name. He witnessed the explosion at the Great Exhibition.
Character 13
Name: Courtney Sithe
Description: Scotland Yard coroner, leader of the Forensic Investigation Team and one of Lord Stronghart's most trusted allies.
Character 14
Name: Enoch Drebber
Description: A trickster who seems to be both an engineer and a magician. He constructed the machine for Professor Harebrayne's demonstration.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.
Evidence 1
Name: Great Exhibition Newspaper
Description: A newspaper containing various articles about the world-leading science and technology on show at the Great Exhibition being held in London.
Evidence 2
Name: Experiment Sketch
Description: A diagram showing the relative positions of the Crystal Tower and Professor Harebrayne's machine that exploded.
Evidence 3
Name: Mysterious Contraption → Crossbow
Description: A very curious device found behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds, almost as if it had been hidden there deliberately. A weapon found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It turns out that it's a folding crossbow. A crossbow found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It belongs to Mr Enoch Drebber.
Evidence 4
Name: Piece of Green Cloth
Description: A torn piece of canvas-like material backed with rubber that was found under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. There are scorch marks at the edges.
Evidence 5
Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim taken after he had ostensibly been 'beamed' to the Crystal Tower. It shows an apparent stab wound to the chest.
Evidence 6
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the victim, Mr Asman. His neck was broken from the impact of a violent fall and he was stabbed in the chest with a sharp object.
Evidence 7
Name: Screwdriver
Description: Professor Harebrayne's trusty screwdriver that he's named 'Andrew'. There are traces of blood at the tip and it matches the shape of the victim's wound. A metal screwdriver that was found poking through the grille in the base of what remains of the kinesis machine. It has a very distinctive handle.
Evidence 8
Name: Photograph of the Balloon
Description: A photograph taken by Gotts whilst he was riding in a balloon. It shows another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after he took this shot.
Evidence 9
Name: Drebber's Card
Description: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, though it shows only the man's name. There is no address. Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, which lists no address for the man. There is a smear of machine oil on the reverse.
Evidence 10
Name: Wooden 'Birdcage'
Description: The wooden cage that was used for Professor Harebrayne's experiment. This cage, with the victim inside, crashed down into the Crystal Tower. The wooden cage that was used for the demonstration. It crashed down, with the victim inside, into the Crystal Tower causing damage to its base.
Evidence 11
Name: Photograph of Drebber
Description: A photographic print of the engineer, Mr Enoch Drebber. It's hard to make out, but he appears to be wearing a monocle with black glass.
Evidence 12
Name: Camera
Description: The camera from around the neck of a waxwork in the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. When the lens is extended, dark staining can be seen on the bellows.
Evidence 13
Name: Piece of Broken Glass
Description: A small fragment of very unusual and thick glass that was found in the folds of the clothing of the Professor waxwork. It would appear to be from the Crystal Tower.
Evidence 14
Name: Science Trophy
Description: A Royal Society trophy for excellence in science that was found in Mr Drebber's workshop. It's a very prestigious award for a young scientist.
Evidence 15
Name: Waxwork Head
Description: The head of the Professor waxwork that was stolen from the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.
Evidence 16
Name: Killer's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the mass murderer known as the Professor, who was tried and found guilty by closed trial ten years ago.
Evidence 17
Name: Post-Explosion Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the experimentation stage after it was completely levelled by a time bomb. The metal floor of the stage has been blown open by the explosion.
Evidence 18
Name: Drebber's Contract
Description: The contract between Mr Asman and Mr Drebber detailing the terms by which they would profit from the kinesis experiment.
Evidence 19
Name: Ten-Year-Old Article
Description: A newspaper article recounting the tale of an eyewitness to the alleged 'resurrection' of the Professor from his grave on the night of his execution.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: It was an incidente terribile. I am only grateful that my balloons were not damaged.
Person: Lune
Testimony 1
Testimony: There's this huge bang from the stage, and then the next second, another bang in the sky beside us.
Person: Gina
Testimony 2
Testimony: And from amid ze smoke...a cage appeared out of nowhere!
Person: Gotts
Testimony 3
Testimony: It voz not ze sky zat exploded. It voz a green balloon zat woz next to ours at ze time.
Person: Gotts
Testimony 4
Testimony: The cage, it fell from the sky like a stone. And crashed into the Crystal Tower!
Person: Lune
Testimony 5
Testimony: I didn't get a good look inside the cage, but no one went near it after it crashed into the tower.
Person: Gina

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to look through the testimonies and see if any of them are contradicted by the evidence provided.

First, let's look at the testimonies one by one. Testimony 3 is from Gotts (Bohemian Boy), and he says, "It voz not ze sky zat exploded. It voz a green balloon zat woz next to ours at ze time." So he's claiming that the explosion in the sky was actually a green balloon next to theirs exploding.

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 8 is a Photograph of the Balloon. The description says it's a photo taken by Gotts while in a balloon, showing another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after the shot. However, Evidence 8 is the photograph itself, which might show a green balloon. But wait, if the testimony says that the explosion was the green balloon, but the evidence (like the photo) might show something different. Alternatively, maybe the photo doesn't show a green balloon, but the testimony says it was green. Wait, the description of Evidence 8 says Gotts claims it was green. So the photo is supposed to support his claim. Hmm, maybe that's not the contradiction.

Let me check another testimony. Testimony 4 from Lune says the cage fell from the sky and crashed into the Crystal Tower. Evidence 10 is the Wooden 'Birdcage' which was used in the experiment and did crash into the tower. That seems consistent. 

Testimony 5 from Gina says she didn't see anyone go near the cage after it crashed. But the Autopsy Report (Evidence 6) says the victim had a broken neck from a fall and a stab wound. If the cage crashed and no one approached, how did he get stabbed? The screwdriver (Evidence 7) has blood matching the wound, which was found in the machine. So maybe the stab wound happened before the explosion. But the testimony says no one went near the cage after the crash, so how was he stabbed? Wait, but the autopsy report says the neck was broken from the fall and the stab wound. So the stabbing could have happened before the fall. But the testimony is about people approaching after the crash. So maybe that's not a contradiction.

Looking back at Testimony 3 and Evidence 8 again. The testimony says the explosion was a green balloon. Evidence 8 is a photo of a balloon that Gotts took, which he claims was green and exploded. But if the photo is black and white (since it's an old photograph), maybe the color isn't visible, but he claims it was green. However, the evidence description says he claims it was green. The photo itself might not show the color, but the testimony is about the color. Wait, but the evidence is a photograph taken by Gotts, which he uses to back his claim. So maybe there's a contradiction here. Alternatively, maybe the crossbow (Evidence 3) is linked to Drebber, and the testimony about the explosion being a balloon is contradicted by evidence of a crossbow being used. Wait, the crossbow is found under the stage. Maybe the explosion wasn't from the balloon but from the crossbow? No, the crossbow is a different device.

Wait, Evidence 17 is the Post-Explosion Photograph showing the stage blown open by a time bomb. But Testimony 1 from Gina mentions a bang from the stage and then another in the sky. So the stage explosion could be the time bomb, but Testimony 3 says the sky explosion was a balloon. So if the stage explosion was a time bomb (Evidence 17), then the balloon explosion (Testimony 3 and Evidence 8) might not be related. But how does that contradict?

Alternatively, Testimony 3 says the explosion was a green balloon. But Evidence 18 is Drebber's Contract with Asman, which might indicate that Drebber had a motive. But not sure how that contradicts.

Wait, looking at Evidence 3: Mysterious Contraption → Crossbow, which belongs to Drebber. The crossbow was hidden under the stage. If the crossbow was used to cause some part of the incident, perhaps the explosion or the stabbing. But the testimonies about the explosions (stage and balloon) might not directly relate. However, the Autopsy Report (Evidence 6) says the victim was stabbed with a sharp object, which matches the screwdriver (Evidence 7) found in the machine. So the crossbow might not be the murder weapon. Hmm.

Wait, Testimony 2 from Gotts says a cage appeared from the smoke. Evidence 10 is the cage that crashed into the tower. That's consistent.

Wait, the contradiction might be between Testimony 5 (Gina says no one went near the cage after it crashed) and the fact that the victim was stabbed (as per Autopsy Report). If the stab wound happened after the crash, then someone must have approached. But the autopsy says the neck was broken from the fall, which would have killed him, and the stab wound was also present. So maybe the stabbing happened before the fall. Therefore, Testimony 5 about no one approaching after the crash doesn't contradict, because the stabbing was before. So that's not it.

Going back to Testimony 3 and Evidence 8. The testimony says the explosion was a green balloon. The evidence is a photo that Gotts took showing a balloon that he claims was green. However, if the photo actually shows a different color or something else, but the problem is the evidence's description states that Gotts claims it was green. So the photo itself might not prove the color, but the testimony is his statement. Maybe the real contradiction is elsewhere.

Looking at Evidence 4: Piece of Green Cloth with scorch marks. If the green cloth is from a balloon, then Testimony 3 about a green balloon exploding would be supported. But the cloth is found under the stage. So maybe the green cloth is from the balloon's remains, but the testimony says the balloon exploded in the sky. If the cloth is under the stage, perhaps the balloon explosion didn't happen in the sky but was part of the stage explosion. That could contradict the testimony. Alternatively, if the green cloth is from the balloon, then the balloon's remnants being under the stage would imply that the balloon was there, not in the sky. So Testimony 3 says the balloon exploded in the sky next to theirs, but the green cloth (Evidence 4) is found under the stage. That would be a contradiction. So if the balloon exploded in the sky, its remnants would be scattered there, not under the stage. But Evidence 4 is under the stage, which might mean the balloon was actually there, contradicting Testimony 3.

Therefore, Evidence 4 (Piece of Green Cloth found under the stage) contradicts Testimony 3 (Gotts says the green balloon exploded in the sky). Because if the balloon exploded in the sky, the green cloth should be there, not under the stage. Hence, the presence of the green cloth under the stage suggests that the balloon was actually under the stage, which contradicts Gotts' testimony that the explosion was in the sky. So the contradiction is between Evidence 4 and Testimony 3.

Evidence 3

Description: A very curious device found behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds, almost as if it had been hidden there deliberately. A weapon found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It turns out that it's a folding crossbow. A crossbow found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It belongs to Mr Enoch Drebber.
Evidence 4
Name: Piece of Green Cloth
Description: A torn piece of canvas-like material backed with rubber that was found under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. There are scorch marks at the edges.
Evidence 5
Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim taken after he had ostensibly been 'beamed' to the Crystal Tower. It shows an apparent stab wound to the chest.
Evidence 6
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the victim, Mr Asman. His neck was broken from the impact of a violent fall and he was stabbed in the chest with a sharp object.
Evidence 7
Name: Screwdriver
Description: Professor Harebrayne's trusty screwdriver that he's named 'Andrew'. There are traces of blood at the tip and it matches the shape of the victim's wound. A metal screwdriver that was found poking through the grille in the base of what remains of the kinesis machine. It has a very distinctive handle.
Evidence 8
Name: Photograph of the Balloon
Description: A photograph taken by Gotts whilst he was riding in a balloon. It shows another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after he took this shot.
Evidence 9
Name: Drebber's Card
Description: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, though it shows only the man's name. There is no address. Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, which lists no address for the man. There is a smear of machine oil on the reverse.
Evidence 10
Name: Wooden 'Birdcage'
Description: The wooden cage that was used for Professor Harebrayne's experiment. This cage, with the victim inside, crashed down into the Crystal Tower. The wooden cage that was used for the demonstration. It crashed down, with the victim inside, into the Crystal Tower causing damage to its base.
Evidence 11
Name: Photograph of Drebber
Description: A photographic print of the engineer, Mr Enoch Drebber. It's hard to make out, but he appears to be wearing a monocle with black glass.
Evidence 12
Name: Camera
Description: The camera from around the neck of a waxwork in the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. When the lens is extended, dark staining can be seen on the bellows.
Evidence 13
Name: Piece of Broken Glass
Description: A small fragment of very unusual and thick glass that was found in the folds of the clothing of the Professor waxwork. It would appear to be from the Crystal Tower.
Evidence 14
Name: Science Trophy
Description: A Royal Society trophy for excellence in science that was found in Mr Drebber's workshop. It's a very prestigious award for a young scientist.
Evidence 15
Name: Waxwork Head
Description: The head of the Professor waxwork that was stolen from the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.
Evidence 16
Name: Killer's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the mass murderer known as the Professor, who was tried and found guilty by closed trial ten years ago.
Evidence 17
Name: Post-Explosion Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the experimentation stage after it was completely levelled by a time bomb. The metal floor of the stage has been blown open by the explosion.
Evidence 18
Name: Drebber's Contract
Description: The contract between Mr Asman and Mr Drebber detailing the terms by which they would profit from the kinesis experiment.
Evidence 19
Name: Ten-Year-Old Article
Description: A newspaper article recounting the tale of an eyewitness to the alleged 'resurrection' of the Professor from his grave on the night of his execution.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: As I said, Balthazar Lune is no liar! Every balloon I had in the sky landed safely!
Person: Lune
Testimony 1
Testimony: All three of my balloons were carrying passengers. If they fell to the ground in an esplosione, what a catastrofe!
Person: Lune
Testimony 2
Testimony: But ya can't get away from the fact that a burnt-up bit o' cloth was found at the scene, can ya?
Person: Gina
Testimony 3
Testimony: The coppers at the Yard reckoned it was prob'ly some debris thrown from the explosion on the stage.
Person: Gina
Testimony 4
Testimony: This stupido ragazzo is mistaken! My balloons have the red and blue zigzag stripes anyway!
Person: Lune

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me try to figure this out. The task is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, I need to go through each testimony and see if any of the evidence directly contradicts what's being said.

First, I'll list out all the testimonies and the key points they're making. Then, I'll check each one against the evidence provided to see if there's a conflict.

Testimony 0: Balthazar Lune says all his balloons landed safely. He's adamant that there were no crashes. But looking at the evidence, Evidence 8 is a photograph of a balloon taken by Gotts, showing another balloon that exploded. This directly contradicts Lune's statement that all balloons landed safely. Also, Testimony 4 from Lune says his balloons have red and blue zigzag stripes, but the photograph might show a green balloon as per Evidence 8's description. Wait, Evidence 8's description says Gotts claims the balloon was green and exploded. So if Lune's balloons are red and blue, but there's a green one in the photo, that's a contradiction. The green balloon in the photo would not belong to Lune, but according to Evidence 11, Balthazar Lune is the owner of the balloons above the experimentation stage. Wait, Evidence 11's description says the balloons above the stage belonged to Lune. So if the photo shows a green balloon from Lune's fleet exploding, but Lune claims all landed safely and that his balloons are red and blue, that's a contradiction. Because the photo (Evidence 8) shows a green balloon exploding, which contradicts Lune's Testimony 4 where he says his balloons have red and blue stripes. Therefore, the green balloon in Evidence 8 would not be his, but according to Evidence 11, all the balloons there are his. So there's a contradiction here. Therefore, Evidence 8 (Photograph of the Balloon) contradicts Testimony 4 (Lune's claim about his balloon colors). Alternatively, Testimony 0 and 1 where he says all balloons landed safely, but Evidence 8 shows an explosion. Wait, Testimony 0 is Lune saying all balloons landed safely. Testimony 1 is him saying if they fell, it would be a catastrophe. But Evidence 8 is a photo showing a balloon exploding. So Evidence 8 contradicts Testimony 0. Because the photo shows a balloon exploding, which would mean it didn't land safely. But according to Lune's Testimony 0, all his balloons did land safely. So the evidence (8) showing an exploding balloon (thus not landing safely) contradicts Testimony 0. However, Testimony 4 is Lune saying the balloons have red and blue stripes, but the photo in Evidence 8 mentions the balloon was green. So if Lune's balloons are red/blue, but the photo shows a green one, that's a contradiction. But according to Evidence 11, the balloons above the stage were his. So either the green balloon is his, which contradicts his testimony about colors, or it's not his, which contradicts Evidence 11. So maybe the contradiction is between Evidence 8 (showing a green balloon that exploded) and Lune's Testimony 4 where he says his balloons have red and blue stripes. Therefore, Evidence 8 contradicts Testimony 4. Because he claims his balloons have red/blue, but the photo shows a green one. So the correct pair would be Evidence 8 and Testimony 4. Let me check the evidence numbers. Evidence 8 is the Photograph of the Balloon, which the description states Gotts claims was green. Testimony 4 is Lune saying his balloons have red and blue zigzag. So the green balloon in the photo contradicts his claim about the colors, thus the evidence 8 and testimony 4 contradict each other.
